website_summaries.verdict: These are great nighttime underwear that keep your child dry and sleeping through the night.
pros: These can work as a diaper for children who are not potty trained but have outgrown  diaper sizes
Marked well for front and back to help children put them on by themselves
Comes in girl and boy styles with colorful characters
XL size can handle children up to 125 pounds
cons: If you get a size that is too big for your child you will likely experience leakage

customer_reviews.title: Super Absorbent!
customer_reviews.text: My 2.5 yr old is a heavy wetter and had to wear 2 Sposie booster pads with his Pampers overnight size 6 diapers. Since we are potty training I tried this. I can’t believ he hasn’t leaked! It is so absorbent and comfortable. He is 37 lbs and 40” tall and the XS fit him perfectly! These are soft and feel comfortable. Not made of crunchy material.
customer_reviews.author: LCO

customer_reviews.title: New product leaks nightly
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased Goodnites for several years and never had an issue; they were the only product on the market that did not leak in the night. However, they recently changed something, and the new pull-ups are terrible. We wake our son up once in the night to use the bathroom, and he still leaks out of the pull-up most nights, despite being well within the weight range. These are a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: jnoelle

customer_reviews.title: No more leaks!
customer_reviews.text: My almost 4yo is 40lbs & 41in. He’s been potty trained during the day for quite some time but is such a heavy sleeper does not wake during naps/nighttime. For months we’ve been using Huggies Overnights with a Sposie pad insert for night (which he’s outgrown) & a pull up for naps. The two weeks prior we had 4 naptime leaks & 5 nighttime leaks. I was skeptical these would work especially for nighttime but it’s been a week and we are leak free! Also he likes wearing the pull ups compared to the diaper of course.
customer_reviews.author: NYAngela

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS ADVERTISED - BAIT AND SWITCH
customer_reviews.text: The positive reviews made me confident to buy them, but I feel like they must have changed the product since all of the positive reviews because The diapers that arrived looked nothing like the advertised pictures of the diapers on the product page. The diapers that arrived are cheaply made, and leaked the first time we tried them. This was a very deceiving product. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: strtup212

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as in the store!
customer_reviews.text: My son was peeing through his diaper every night until we switched to these. I bought them at CVS and Walmart and they worked great! Never had any leaks and he is a heavy wetter. After using them for about 3 months I ordered them on Amazon and they are leaking like crazy!!! I don't think these are the same as you get in the store or I got a bad batch. It seemed a little odd when I didn't get them in the usual "Goodnights" box, it was just plain. I won't be ordering again.
customer_reviews.author: AO

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for incontinence
customer_reviews.text: I have a child with a congenital birth defect and he has to wear these 24/7. They're a life saver for keeping him feeling like a normal little boy. They work great. They need to be changed about every 3 hours and he has to wear two at night. The only improvement would be velcro sides. This would mean he doesn't have to take off his pants and shoes for every change. They really are a life saver for us. We've tried lots of different options to save money or inserts so he doesn't have to take off pants/shoes, but we always end up switching back to these.
customer_reviews.author: SlyMomma

customer_reviews.title: Skip this Product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product thinking it would be good for a three-year-old toddler who was soaking through overnight size 6 diapers. However this product was much worse as you can see by the large circle on the bed and I didn’t even take a picture of him who is even wearing more pee than is on the bed! Do not bother to purchase this product
customer_reviews.author: Three Chis

customer_reviews.title: Used to work great.  Yet another product now cutting corners to save money.
customer_reviews.text: We used these for nearly two years without issue, couldn't remember a leak, lately we've had leaks very frequently. The odd thing is that each time these obviously weren't soaked through, yet my Son's pajamas and bed were soaked. Upon closer inspection, the most recent ones we've received have only a narrow strip down the middle, compare that to the image on the right which has the absorption material from seam to seam. Used to be a five star product, not anymore. Switching to UnderJams
customer_reviews.author: WET

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the older potty trained but sound sleeping child
customer_reviews.text: My 5 yr old son NEVER has accidents during the day, but he sleeps so hard that he doesn't wake while urinating at night. I was using the largest size diaper, but he wet through that nearly every night. These pull ups have saved me SO much laundry!!! He hasn't wet through at all since starting to wear them months ago. Yay!!!!!!!!! And my son loves the fact that he can put them on himself rather than getting diapered like his baby sister:). A definite win for everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Cara

customer_reviews.title: They had to change something!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These used to be my favorite diaper as my son is Autistic and not potty trained yet. They would last a long time and no issues throughout the night. This lastest order has been nothing but problems. Leaks, sagging after the first urination. Either these are knockoffs or the quality went downhill quickyly.
customer_reviews.author: Candice

customer_reviews.title: Good And Bad!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2Year Old who weighs 53lbs. For his weight this is all he can wear/ fit but they’re falling apart .. This is the third box I’ve purchased .. Some Goodnites are hard like already used, some the outlining is off/ falling off! They are decent and I must buy because of his weight but I don’t like buying damaged items and they are iffy for using overnight.
customer_reviews.author: BellAh Disaster

customer_reviews.title: great quality and fun prints
customer_reviews.text: My toddler loves wearing these Goodnites. Between the Spider-Man pattern and the fact that they come on/off like "big boy" underwear, he gets really excited to put them on at night. I was pleasantly surprised with how absorbent these are! They're very thick between the legs, but not to the point that it appears to make children uncomfortable when moving. When my toddler sleeps for 10-12 hours, he absolutely needs absorbing underwear at night. Some mornings I think he will have for sure leaked through to the sheets, and he never does, even though the Goodnite feels like its 2 pounds with everything it absorbed.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Caudill

customer_reviews.title: Best fitting bedwetting diaper we found!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best fitting bedwetting products we've found. The material is smooth so there is no complaints from my son of it being "scratchy" like he does if I try putting him in a pull-up. I like that it goes down to the smaller size so I could use it with my 3 year old, yet also came in bigger sizes so that when my oldest was still wet at 8 it would fit her well too. Used this for various amounts of time (every child is different) with all 4 of my kids. Would highly recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Was amazed
customer_reviews.text: These are the only 60-125 lbs diapers till adult , other brands state 60-85 lbs as Under Jams , but no. under Jams are not 60-85 lbs for my son. My youngest son in the autism spectrum has to have this brand and size, and he is 80 lbs, and Under Jams do not fit him. Under Jams stopped fitting him at 72 lbs... There was a mix up with the postal service with a purchase of Good Nights , and Amazon fixed it instantly, arrived same day as the issue. Just a few hours after contacting Amazon. I used to go through Walmart for this brand and size. I am happy I went through amazon this time :D
customer_reviews.author: William N.

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for children with special needs
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this for children with special needs! My 6 year old son has autism & is non verbal, and he's still not potty trained yet, so with him being 55 pounds it's hard to find any pull ups are his size, and if they do they usually leak. I'm very thankful for this brand of pull ups because of the bigger sizes and they don't leak at all. Although most people wouldnt be thankful over something like this, as a struggling mother I've learned to count my blessings and appreciate the smaller things in life too. Thank you for that.
customer_reviews.author: Jgardner

customer_reviews.title: Great for Bedtime!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old autistic son wears these to bed in a size Small. He is nearly 4ft tall, approx. 46 lbs and these fit him great. We have struggled with the potty for over 2 years now. He still has daily accidents so he wears 4T-5T Pull-Ups during the day. Some days he does so well on the potty but definitely goes in his Goodnites throughout the night. Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stefani M.

customer_reviews.title: Nighttime with some help
customer_reviews.text: My 10 y/o uses these at night after using the ones "for girls" during the day. I put an extra absorbent Poise pad in these, her night time diapers to help them go thru the night. At 90 lbs. she isn't quite fitting the Depends brand. A quick glance at her behind and I know if she has on a daytime (pink) or nighttime (blue) diaper.
customer_reviews.author: dawnro

customer_reviews.title: No more leaks!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old son still wears pull ups at nights. I had always used Huggies overnights since he was little but they leaked once or twice a week. So I tried Pampers overnights (although I don't like how they are scented) and those leaked every other night. I was getting tired of washing sheets and mattress cover every other day so I researched for a better brand and decided to give these a try. He's been using them for about 2 weeks now and we haven't had one leak yet! So happy as I don't see my son out of nighttime pull ups any time soon! Thanks for making a great product!
customer_reviews.author: mth

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as what you get in the store
customer_reviews.text: I don’t believe these are the same as what you buy in the store. They came in unmarked plastic and have no markings on the actual product. Every night they leak. Every. Single. Night. Last night we changed him in the middle Of the night and then the second one leaked too in our bed. Skip this.
customer_reviews.author: MAA

customer_reviews.title: MUST BUY
customer_reviews.text: My sons are 3 and are completely potty trained during the day but have no control when they are asleep. This meant that every morning they woke up drenched, their diapers, their pajamas, their bed. It was a disaster. We tried sizing up in diapers, but they always wet through. It was so frustrating. Finally, I went to Google and found Goodnites, and I’ve never looked back. My sons have woken up dry every morning since wearing Goodnites. Which means more sleep for all of us and less laundry for me!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Badnites?
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. I got these bc my 3 yr old often wets through his Huggies nighttime pull-ups at night. I read good things about the Goodnites, so I decided to give 'em a try. So far, they've only kept him dry one night..other nights (last night included) he had wet the bed before 3am! That ain't "good"! I don't get too upset about it bc I know one day I'll miss the times that he even needed a pull-up...but still. The $$$ we parents shell out for these things is unreal and they hardly do what they're supposed to! Just sayin.
customer_reviews.author: Mommin ain't easy

customer_reviews.title: Toddler potty trainer
customer_reviews.text: After my toddler outgrew his size 7 diapers, I had no idea what I was going to use for nighttime diapers. So, I spent a lot of money on Grovia cloth potty training diapers and they leaked, smelled and my son had a hard time taking them off. I was so happy to find Goodnites. We have not had any leaks, they don't smell when peed in and my son can take them off by himself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for potty training
customer_reviews.text: My son is 3 yo and has outgrown pampers easy ups. He weighs 50 lbs and wears a size 6 clothes so he's a big boy. The largest size pull ups just do not fit him, way too tight around the top of his legs. And he does not want to wear underwear. So happy that I found good nites! He needs some type of protection when we go out, and at night, since he's not fully potty trained. He doesn't potty in them a lot but the few times he has the good nites have held up well with no leaking. These are a great substitute for pullups at a comparable price and aren't just for overnight.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Little Boy and Belly Sleeper....Goodnites To The Rescue
customer_reviews.text: After weeks of changing the sheets every single morning, I finally don’t need to visit my washer first thing in the morning. These Goodnites have saved my sanity. My 3 year old son was waking up with a soaked bed but somehow his diaper was almost dry. Let’s just say a belly sleeper and morning wood was not a good combo. He’d pee right up through the diaper and onto the bed. He was already in a size 6 and tried everything including overnights. They didn’t help at all. Finally decided to give the XS a try and we are now waking up to dry sheets every morning!
customer_reviews.author: Darcy Skye

customer_reviews.title: Great for younger kids
customer_reviews.text: For a five-year-old who's potty training this product is pretty good but when a child is this old, sometimes the diaper can't contain things and we get leaks. But for the most part they stay dry throughout the night good. I'm sure for a younger child it will work much better. My son is approximately 46 lb and it fits him pretty well but if he gets too much bigger I think that we would have to get the picture size.
customer_reviews.author: Gina A. Marandino

customer_reviews.title: These stopped the leaks!
customer_reviews.text: I used Pampers for my son for 5 years but when they changed their design 6 months the ago my son started leaking through his diaper almost every night. We even woke him up late night to use the restroom one more time - inconvenient for everyone - and they were still leaking 1 or 2 times per leak. The GoodNites are MUCH better. Without waking my son up at in the middle of the night these are still keeping him much dryer. I'd say one leak every 3 or 4 weeks. Such a relief.
customer_reviews.author: Baamboo22

customer_reviews.title: The small size fit my tall 5 year old perfect. He was leaking out of the biggest size ...
customer_reviews.text: The small size fit my tall 5 year old perfect. He was leaking out of the biggest size pull ups. I was worried about moving to these as he's so skinny by they fit great. Also the prints are more age appropriate. Unlike generic goodnites these do not leak!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: LOOKING INTO A DIFFERENT BRAND!
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these for almost a year and had no problem at night with my son. However with this last purchase I got, I have had nothing but issues. My son can not stop messing with them because they are bothering him and we have had to change the sheets every-night this week including 3 times in the same night. I don’t know what they changed but these are a parents worse nightmare to put on a sleeping child and expect them to wake up dry. LOOKING INTO A DIFFERENT BRAND!
customer_reviews.author: Corey Shere

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves the pictures. Good proection against most leaks. My son is 45" and ~43lbs. As long as he goes right before bed and doesnt drink anything it will hold about one sm-med sized "use". Will leak if its large or he goes twice in his sleep. I would recommend this still bc this is really the best youll ever find until your child is fully trained (weve tried all different types)
customer_reviews.author: Jeni Q

customer_reviews.title: Great for potty trained 3 yo but needs overnight protection
customer_reviews.text: My 3yo is potty trained but we have mastered nighttime yet. I always used the huggies overnight but heard about the recent quality change in those diapers so I felt it was time to change to a new brand. My son seems to only pee once a night so hes not a heavy bedwetter. These are great! No leaks and he loves spiderman so he’s happy to wear them. He is 31lbs and the xs is perfect. I also like that they are pullups so I can tell my son these are his nighttime undies instead of calling them diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Great for 3.5yo bedwetter
customer_reviews.text: We've been having serious night diaper leakage problems with our 3.5yo son, who rarely wakes up in the night to use the bathroom. These finally do the job and have given the added bonus of encouraging him to wake up in the night to use the potty since he feels like they are like underwear instead of a diaper (they're basically thick pullups). They are worth the money they're saving us in aggravation, laundry detergent, and a new mattress down the line.
customer_reviews.author: LTTaniguchiTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: No leakage and easy to pull up and down!
customer_reviews.text: These are the only overnight protection I have found that actually works for my 5 year old and he loves the fun characters! They super hero characters name him feel like he is not wearing a "diaper" and more grown up. They are easy to pull up and down for emergency middle of the night bathroom trips too!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay infantino

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Bedwetting Underwear
customer_reviews.text: Goodnites Boys Bedwetting Underwear I love these underwear this is the only one that I purchase. If I can't find them at one store I will go to another store or search online. What I like most about the GoodNites Boys Bedwetting Underwear is that they don't leak and not only are the great to put on your child at bed time. They are also great when potty training. I love Goodnites Boys Bedwetting Underwear they are the best.
customer_reviews.author: Zack G.

customer_reviews.title: amazing product
customer_reviews.text: i am 15 years old and weigh 119 and these fit good and snug. i have tried on pull ups as well and i can say these are incredible compared to the pull ups. when i peed in the pull ups they would got though the pull up after a full pee. with these i can pee about two-two and a half times and they are full. these do not leak when i move around in bed or just walking in general. the leak guards actually work and work well. over all a really good diaper.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Ross

customer_reviews.title: Tired of washing sheets and pajamas! These work
customer_reviews.text: Our 6 year old is a deep deep deep sleeper. It has been a blessing since he was born but the downside is that he doesnt always wake at night to go pee. We love the Goodnites and they are an excellent value online. No issues with leaking.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly what I paid for...
customer_reviews.text: I have a 13 year old that’s 86 pounds and a heavy wetter. After using them for a day or two he explained that they were large, smelly, crinkly diaper. They were not discrete and had a strong chemical smell. We had bought the larger size because he was constantly leaking and the first pack was a big letdown. They are supposed to fit and act like underwear but he’s not fooled. Besides all the negatives they absorb quite well and are very comfortable(in his words).
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Best diaper for accidents at night
customer_reviews.text: Always buy these as they leak the least of all the brands and fit the best. My son says these are the most comfortable as I've tried many other brands to try and save money. Sometimes paying a bit more is worth the cost when they work the best.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Darstein

customer_reviews.title: Yaaasss, just buy them!
customer_reviews.text: Life saver! My son is small. He will be 3 in a few days and weighs 25 lbs. It's so hard to find potty training/overnight underwear for smaller toddlers. The xs are wonderful! The only time my son doesn't wait to potty is when he is asleep. He's just mastered the whole awake potty training so we aren't trying to push too much for night time. We wanted to make sure he knew there were NO more diapers in the house, only big boy underwear. These have worked wonders. They are pricey but they work. Some nights he pees quite a bit and these things hold up just fine! We are very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney D

customer_reviews.title: Way better than diapers!
customer_reviews.text: These are soft and comfortable and protect way better than diapers. Because they wrap around like underwear, there is no room on the side for them to open up and leak. Our son never wore pull-ups, but he loves these. They are so much softer. And they can be easily pulled down and up like underwear so when our little one needs to go to the bathroom before bed, he can easily do that while wearing these. I highly recommend them!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicky

customer_reviews.title: Great transition out of pullups
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for my son who can still fit into pullups as far as weight is concerned, but has issues with them coming apart on the sides while he's wearing them. He only wears them at night and they do a good job protecting him from any accidents and have yet to leak. I wish there was more variety in the designs , but that doesn't have any effect on how they work.
customer_reviews.author: GypsyRose_03

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: These are super absorbent and great for a child who might not be potty training age (or on the verge) but just too big for the nighttime diapers they make. My son has been in size 7 diapers since before 2, so finding a nighttime diaper to hold him through the night was hard. So glad we made the switch to these, and bonus that they are on Amazon subscribe and Save. Also, the Hulk graphic is the best. We will continue to use these until we are fully potty trained, and will always recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TheInternets

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my two year old who was leaking through his other diapers. These are cute and they hold up all through the night without a single leak. He is about forty pounds and I got him the small medium. They don’t let off a smell either which pampers did. I will continue to get him these from now until he is fully potty trained or at least can get up in the middle of the night to use his potty
customer_reviews.author: Angel Adams

customer_reviews.title: These worked so much better than I anticipated!!
customer_reviews.text: Honest review here. I was searching for 'best night time diapers' as these came up in a size six... they worked very well for leak protection, absorbency and night time. Overall they do work as described. I originally annoyed bc I thought bc of a pull-up they wouldn’t work as well. Turns out they worked better than a regular diaper for absorbency. Happily surprised. Hope that is helpful!
customer_reviews.author: baby momma knows

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold much
customer_reviews.text: During the day these would be great I imagine. But for bedtime? No. My son is 3 1⁄2 and potty trained except at night. We just haven't gotten that down yet. We used up all the diapers we had left during the nights and bought these goodnights thinking maybe they would work even better. No. The few nights my son doesn't wake up the goodnights pullup has him wet. I hoped for better.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Worst waste of money
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely terrible. My son only used these twice & it has been a complete waste of money. The 1st night he woke up with a random rash on his bottom & spots of blood. This morning he woke up & the diaper had literally exploded all over his bed. The little diaper beads were everywhere. These are the worst purchase I have ever made. Please don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: ellie walker

customer_reviews.title: change is not always best
customer_reviews.text: In September, I personally sent a feedback email to Goodnites customer service & a rep called me back. please know as I told them i have always loved and stood by this product. now it is inconceivable how the product quality has changed to such an extent my child can no longer wear these without suffering skin irritation and the remaining details I will leave unsaid. the absorbing of urine or otherwise has or is now obsolete. so disappointed. will no longer recommend or purchase this product. ever
customer_reviews.author: Gwen G

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my 11-month old and 3-year old!
customer_reviews.text: Sooooo glad I tried these! My 11-month old would wake up soaked almost every morning, but these are the solution. He weighed 24 pounds at his last doctor visit, so I was afraid these might leak around the leg openings, but they haven't. They are great! Maybe he will sleep later now! I am also using these for my just-turned-3-year-old. They are perfect for him, too. He weighs 30 pounds. Thanks to the company for a great product, and for God to leading me to it!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Only brand I buy
customer_reviews.text: I love these, my son has the occasional accident at night while he sleeps. We bought this from our local Walmart so he could wear them to bed just in case. I been back to get more since multiple times and everytime they are sold out. So I decided why not go through amazon subscriptions and then I don’t have to worry about running out or going out to get more just for them not to have them in stock. What a wise decision that was!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffyy227

customer_reviews.title: Best absorbency out of any overnight we’ve ever used!!
customer_reviews.text: I use these as an overnite pull-up for my son. We’ve been using them for about a month now and I think he’s only leaked it of them once and that was due to positioning because the pull-up was hardly wet! My son is a heavy wetter and these absorb a TON, more than any other pull up we’ve used. They’re just a little big on him which I believe accounted for the one leak so far! I will be buying these again when we use up what we have!
customer_reviews.author: Richael Saxon

customer_reviews.title: Holds a lot, runs big, scarry graphics
customer_reviews.text: They hold a lot. When my son was a 2t the xs wasn’t tight enough around his waist, so we ended up putting underwear over it so that the underwear elastic could hold the top shut. This works, but lessens the amount they can hold. Now that he’s a 3t the xs fits. Biggest issue is that all sizes have Spider-Man on them; though this might be great for your 8 year old, when your two year old thinks he’s terrifying, it causes some issues at bedtime.
customer_reviews.author: Responsible Online Citizen

customer_reviews.title: Not the same overnight diaper.
customer_reviews.text: Something with these changes when the packaging changed. They are thinner and way less absorbent. My sons leaks through every single night. Bring back the old Goodnites!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Dahl

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: We changed my son’s diaper right before we’d lay him down at night but he kept peeing through his diaper. So, we’ve been using these for a few months and have only had one incident. And the seem so comfortable. Easy to put on. A little rough to get off if he has pooped. Can’t really just pull them down because the poop would fall out. So, I have to literally rip them off. Not easy but not a deal breaker for me.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine P

customer_reviews.title: Good pull-ups.
customer_reviews.text: Just as good as huggies if not a little better. Compared to size 6 or so buggies for the smallest size they sell of good nights. I’m an environmentalist so this product doesn’t cut every expectation for me but i needed these right away and have used them and decided to review. Pull-ups work well, haven’t had any leak problems but my kid doesn’t keep it on long enough anyways lol 😂
customer_reviews.author: EcoMainiac

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for leaky nighttime problems
customer_reviews.text: My toddler has always been a heavy peeing fool especially at night. He had thicker thighs before 1 but has since slimmed down (same weight just much taller now). I used XS when he was 11 months old. They were big on him but never leaked. I wasn’t able to change him during night with reg diapers without him waking up for good. These helped solve that. 12 hours no leaks. He isn’t one to poop ever at night so I didn’t have to worry about that when they were little big on him.
customer_reviews.author: mking4892

customer_reviews.title: No leaks and they fit comfortably. I have no worries about wet sheets
customer_reviews.text: These have worked well for our young elementary ages child. No leaks and they fit comfortably. I have no worries about wet sheets. My child even chose not to change out of them one day, while getting dressed. I did not notice till after lunch when clothing started to show signs of being wet. They had held all the pee up to that point, which was pretty impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Read Me:
customer_reviews.text: I have a fatty fat 2 year old and these are the only diapers I've found that A.fit his badonk and B.actually contains his bladder! These babies have blessed us with totally 100% dry nights! I use them during the day too since regular diapers look like G-strings on him. Wish more came in a pack for the price I'm being charged but whatever I'll pay this higher premium for something that actually works!
customer_reviews.author: AleashaMatthews

customer_reviews.title: Work Like Magic
customer_reviews.text: I bought a small/medium for my 5 year old who started bed wetting when I brought the latest baby home. He's a stalky size 6, and these fit well. He's only had 2 accidents once I got these before he was back to normal, but these caught every drop, and nothing made it to his jammies or the sheets. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Dee

customer_reviews.title: No leaks and great quality
customer_reviews.text: I just moved my big guy from the S/M to the L/XL and the size difference is pretty drastic. The smaller size was too small at 60 pounds but the bigger size is ginormous on him. They still work well and we very rarely have leaks over night. I just wish there was a middle size.
customer_reviews.author: Cody M

customer_reviews.title: great for holding large amount of pee
customer_reviews.text: love this diapers! my son really enjoys the cartoon design, which they do switch overtime, so never gets boring. It saved my life! I was washing sheets every other day, no other diaper can hold my 18 months old son's overnight pee until this one. So I've been using it over a year now. no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Duan Lin

customer_reviews.title: Packaging does vary but so does the underwear.
customer_reviews.text: I did see packaging may vary but did not think the underwear would also vary. If you are expecting the underwear to feature the Hulk, you will be disappointed. For this reason I am returning them
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Best thing we have found for our daughter
customer_reviews.text: We use these for my special needs daughter. We tried the girl ones several times but they always leak. Since she is a stomach sleeper we decided to try the boy ones since they have extra protection in the front and it works amazingly. We no longer have to change the sheets every day and give a second bath.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Leak proof
customer_reviews.text: These are super simple even for my autistic kid to figure out how to place them on and take them off. They literally last all night even if she has a milk before bed and most diapers never would but these ones hold up great maybe once in a while you’ll have a leak but that’s a very slim chance
customer_reviews.author: Nikolle

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: My son has been using these for many years and he just turned 12. He is very tall for his age measuring about 5'6 and 110 pounds. He has had some medical problems since he was a baby. I was so worried about what to do when he grew out of pull ups and then I found these, which have been a life saver!
customer_reviews.author: Megan F Belloso

customer_reviews.title: The best leak-proof diapers.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these along with another brand that said they were good for day and night. One night I just used one of those other diapers to put him to bed and let's just say we had to do laundry in the morning! The Goodnights never leaked and were a much better fit for night time use.
customer_reviews.author: Melisa Singh

customer_reviews.title: Picture is misleading...
customer_reviews.text: A little misleading. The picture is of a 75ct box but it’s only a 34ct box. Please use the correct number on the box next time.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa S.

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick!
customer_reviews.text: These work great and aren’t so expensive as the name brand ones. I have had them occasionally leak but not that often, not enough for me to spend more money on another brand. Also, my four year old is a big kid and these fit well and don’t pinch into his skin like some others do.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Quality not the same
customer_reviews.text: These slip on diapers are not the same as the ones I have ordered previously. The strands of the diaper come out easily after 1 time pee. It's not as absorbent as those I have used in my previous orders of the same. Could they be duplicates? I don't know . Hope someone can explain to me why.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: Happy so far
customer_reviews.text: These do a great job for the older kids with medical "issues." My son's first reaction was that they felt stiff stiff, but once on he said they felt much better than the other brands. He has a TON of room to grow in these, where he was getting snug in the l/xl of the other brands.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ross

customer_reviews.title: These work!
customer_reviews.text: These are the only diapers that will contain the pee for us. My little guy isn't very big but was leaking out of the size 6 and 7 night time diapers of other brands. He's been wearing these since he turned 3 (and only 30 pounds). They look a little silly because they are so big on him but they really, really work.
customer_reviews.author: Zebe Sakayama

customer_reviews.title: Good for potty training
customer_reviews.text: Our boys only wear diapers when they go to bed. The boys said they feel comfortable wearing this diaper. The absorbency is okay, we haven’t had any leaks so far, however, we do stop letting the boys drink any kind of fluid few hours before they go to bed.
customer_reviews.author: Cozilla

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for us
customer_reviews.text: These were terrible for us. My son was occasionally leaking out of 4t pampers pull ups so i switched to these based on reviews. These were awful and he leaked out every single night he wore them. They are not absorbent at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley A Gottschang

customer_reviews.title: We are very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Our son is potty trained during the day but is nowhere near being potty trained at night. He was leaking every other night through his overnight diapers so I was looking for another solution and found these. So far, as long as they are pulled on well and he hasn't had a huge amount to drink before bed, they hold everything in so that he doesn't wake up with wet PJs in the morning. We are very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: David Clark

customer_reviews.title: No overnight leaks yet!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year-old son still struggles staying dry overnight. The Pull-Ups just weren't cutting it anymore for overnight use and seemed to result in leakages occasionally. I was skeptical that these could be any different, but, they seem to sit up a little higher on his waist and fit better against his body. No leaks yet! I'm so glad I decided to try the GoodNites.
customer_reviews.author: Mama V

customer_reviews.title: Use in place of pullups- fit my son better.
customer_reviews.text: I used these while potty training my son, he's always been big (not fat, tall) so I used these because the pullups did not fit him. The sizing for these worked so much better. The absorbency is so much better than the pullups too.
customer_reviews.author: Skye

customer_reviews.title: My son leaks wearing TWO !!!
customer_reviews.text: If zero stars were an option that’s what I would have went with. My 3.5 yo son has leaked through these and I even put two on him !!! He still leaks through two pull ups and wakes us wet. I am so disappointed because I wake up and have to wash clothes and sheets every morning. These are not leak proof !!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as pull-ups IMO
customer_reviews.text: My son is such a heavy sleeper that sometimes pull-ups (the biggest size I can get at Costco) leak even when we limit his water before bed! I was super excited to try these and hoped since they are designed for bigger kids they would not have that problem but they actually leak even worse! I can see that they would be good if you have a kids with occasional minimal bed wetting but if you have a heavy sleeper who just can’t wake up to go stick with pull ups!
customer_reviews.author: Mamaof4

customer_reviews.title: Plain boxes was a plus for the kid.
customer_reviews.text: Come in plain brown packs, so the kids aren't put on the spot like buying them at target! I just wish the underpants were of the quality they were before, when they were absorbant enough for my first child's whole night... These may require mid-night switches if your kid is a bit older.
customer_reviews.author: CJ77

customer_reviews.title: Most Absorbent, Worth the Money!!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other (off) brands and these are by far worth the money. My son is 8 and had problems with bed wetting. We have tried so many things, and he still wakes up with the whole bed soaked. These have been a real life saver for all of us!!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Pinner

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for the Money .
customer_reviews.text: Good Value for the Money . They work most of the time, fits right as per size descriptions. There is minor occasional leaks ( i guess that is mostly due to overuse as kids tend to be super naughty sometimes ) . Overall i will rate it as " 9 OUT OF 10 ".
customer_reviews.author: NP

customer_reviews.title: Night protection for little boys
customer_reviews.text: We have had a few leaks with these, but not many compared to all the nights we’ve had great protection. So for the most part, they work well for my 4 year old son. We just use them at night as my son doesn’t need them during the day. They seem comfy enough for him. I like them fine so I keep them on my subscribe and save.
customer_reviews.author: BagLady

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: These are the best pull ups I’ve bought. It’s worth the price because the cheaper ones leak. I was washing sheets everyday before I found these. And the material is close to a cloth feel and for more like underwear than a diaper.
customer_reviews.author: Kiera

customer_reviews.title: Description says boys and I received pink!
customer_reviews.text: The description says boys version and I received the girl version. My 10 yo boy with health issues, is now angry and disappointed in pink undergarments. They are so expensive to just a toss out at this size. Won’t buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Great for little bed-wetters
customer_reviews.text: My eight yo son still wets the bed. These are plenty absorbent for his night time accidents. They do leak a little bit on heavy nights. Nothing is ever perfect. Good product. Been using these for years.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy R.

customer_reviews.title: Work great!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 and 3 year olds both use these at night and they work great! They wear them all night and never have any leaking by morning! I’ve tried several other kinds of night time diapers and non compared to these on any level! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kylie Marie

customer_reviews.title: Absorbent for Big Kids
customer_reviews.text: My son is 98th percentile for his height, so even though we started potty training at age 3 1/2, it was hard to find overnight diapers that were big and absorbent enough for him. For tall, big toddlers, I definitely recommend this line for overnight dryness. I like the character design too
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: Great night time diaper
customer_reviews.text: I have special needs twin boys, and they are day time potty trained. I love these diapers for night time. These are the any diapers that can hold one of my twin boys pee. That one pees a lot at one time.
customer_reviews.author: Cloth Diapering Mama

customer_reviews.title: Life Changing For Parents Of Heavy Night Wetters
customer_reviews.text: These were GAME CHANGERS for us. Went from nightly diaper and sheet changes to sleeping through the whole night dry and peacefully. My 2yo son drinks a lot of water, and so he has always been a heavy wetter throughout the night and these have never caused an issue or leaked. I even use them on long car rides just in case :) WAY better than any goodnight “diaper.” I wish we had thought to put him in these night time pull up style diapers sooner!!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Saved this Mom’s sanity!
customer_reviews.text: These have saved me. I have two boys who both periodically wet the bed. It does not matter if I cut off liquids two hours before bedtime, nor if I have them use the restroom before bed. They fall asleep so deeply that they do not wake when they need to go. I do have them reuse the goodnites as long as they’re not soiled. They’re kinda pricey to not reuse them.
customer_reviews.author: Chefmom

customer_reviews.title: Hulk Can’t Smash These
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old LOVES putting on his Hulk smash nighttimes. Maybe that’s why he’s coming up on 4 and still isn’t potty trained at night. Hmmm? Regardless, they hold up through the night and are fun for him to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy T

customer_reviews.title: Absorbency
customer_reviews.text: I buy these because I have a 7 year old very heavy sleeper. I stop allowing him to have water about 6 and he goes to bed between 7-8. We wake him up at 10 to pee before we go to bed. On occasion he still weats the bed and goes through his pull-up. I will say though, this is the only pull-ups we have found that hold as well as they do.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: I miss the previous design
customer_reviews.text: I have to say the quality is about the same as the previous version, but I like the previous design more. My sons does not like this greenish color... I hope we can have options to choose the designs.
customer_reviews.author: Jing

customer_reviews.title: When pull ups and easy ups don't work...
customer_reviews.text: My son was in need of pull up for potty training, but hes a big guy so pull ups and easy ups did not fit him properly at all. They barely made it over his thighs. I use the goodnites as pull ups/ potty training diapers for my son. The price difference is negligible and they do wonders at holding moisture. The only problem is probably that the elastic sides are a bit weak and sometimes rip when putting them on. Otherwise a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier S.Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Work great, love the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best way to buy these. Soo cost effective! In the stores you get less then half this amount for like $20! Will never go back to buying them any other way and have already recommended them. Also this is the one brand that we've tried that actually works!
customer_reviews.author: The Kid's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Fit is good, No leak issues, Great Design
customer_reviews.text: These have worked out great for every day use, not just overnight. No issues with leaking. Love the Spider Man design. Wish they had more patterns available in the XS size (like hulk), and that they were more natural (and forthright about exactly what is in these, including chemicals), but I figure they are short-lived, so works fine for us.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: The search continues...
customer_reviews.text: The XS GoodNites leaked. My 3 year old soaked his bed the very first night and I returned the box. Huggies Overnites... my son complains the velcro-style sides hurt him. So, the search continues...
customer_reviews.author: Bridgette

customer_reviews.title: New version is terrible, brind back the old style!
customer_reviews.text: I used to swear by these and now I'm forced to find an alternative. The old version was much better and this new style has me changing sheets and cleaning the mattress. If anyone finds a better product, please let me know in a review and I will do the same.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Payne

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.text: My son has always had issues peeing through at night and we'd always wake up soaked and crying! These diapers are a huge lifesaver! Especially in the potty training stage! I wish I would've found these sooner! They are usually full by the time he wakes up but we haven't had 1 single issue! Don't hesitate in finding night time bums! Buy these NOW!! You won't regret it! ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
customer_reviews.author: Nersha

customer_reviews.title: Only diapers that don't leak
customer_reviews.text: My son is potty trained but not at night. I tried other brands over night diapers and none seemed to work. These did the trick, comfortable and stretchy. My son is 50lbs these fit a bit big but I rather it fit big instead of tight.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: So thankful for home delivery of this product. No ...
customer_reviews.text: So thankful for home delivery of this product. No chance of having someone my child knows see us in the store with this in our cart. He feels more confident. These things are a god-send if you have a bed wetter!
customer_reviews.author: Momofsix

customer_reviews.title: Best night-time protection!
customer_reviews.text: This household has used Goodnites for a few years and I swear i would have gone mental by now washing sheets at 3am if it wasn't for these. While there is the occasional leak here and there, I think it depends on his position or something. I would say about 90% of the time these work flawlessly. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: C.A.

product_meta.title: Goodnites Bedwetting Underwear for Boys, Small/Medium, 44 Ct
product_meta.description: Size:Small/Medium| Style:Giga PackHelp your child wake up dry with the #1 Nighttime Underwear* for bedwetting. Goodnites provide the best nighttime protection guaranteed** for kids age 3-12. These disposable pants feature Double Leg Barriers to help eliminate leaks and 5 Layer Protection to absorb & lock away wetness. Goodnites also feature a super stretchy waistband for a comfortable, underwear-like fit that accommodates all body shapes. Unlike training pants, Goodnites bedwetting underwear discreetly absorb odor and offer 40% more protection*** where he needs it most. Plus your child will love going to bed wearing his favorite Marvel superhero designs. Goodnites for Boys are available in sizes XS (28-45 lb.), S/M (38-65 lb.), and L/XL (60-125+ lb.). *Youth Pant Category **See Goodnites website for details ***vs. the leading training pant
feature_bullets: Disposable bedwetting underwear fits children 38-65 lb. (17-29 kg)
The #1 Nighttime Underwear* brand that has helped more than 10 million kids manage overnight bed wetting
Nighttime bed wetting pants with 40% more protection vs. the leading training pant
Best Nighttime Protection Guaranteed** with 5 Layer Protection and extra absorbency where he needs it most, plus Double Leg Barriers to help prevent leaks
Stretchy waistband that provides a soft, underwear-like fit for all body shapes
Worry less about the mess with discreet odor absorption, plus Marvel superhero designs your child will love wearing to bed

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
